primary_structure_type: massive body with large ears and trunk
primary_structure_color: grey to brownish-grey, often covered in dust
key_differentiating_features: Very large ears shaped like African continent
Both males and females have tusks
Trunk with two finger-like projections at tip
Rounded head with no dip between forehead and trunk
confusion_species_list: Loxodonta cyclotis (African Forest Elephant - smaller, straighter tusks)
Elephas maximus (Asian Elephant - smaller ears, domed head)
sexual_dimorphism_notes: Males significantly larger with thicker tusks; females have thinner, more curved tusks
